revised_title: Immune Recognition of Influenza Virus Hemagglutinin: Antigenic Sites and Helper T-Cell Recognition
tldr: This article discusses the immune recognition of the hemagglutinin protein in influenza viruses. It identifies five antigenic sites on the hemagglutinin protein that are recognized by infectivity-neutralizing antibodies and describes how these sites change during the antigenic drift of influenza viruses. The article also explores the recognition of hemagglutinin by helper T cells and how their specificities overlap with antibody recognition.
